task.title: Master Array Concatenation
task.problemStatement: Create functions demonstrating different ways to combine arrays using concat() method and spread operator syntax. Compare performance and use cases.

challenges.title: Concat Multiple Arrays
challenges.description: Write a function that takes multiple arrays as arguments and combines them using concat() method.

challenges.title: Spread Operator Array Merging
challenges.description: Create a function that merges arrays using spread operator and compare it with concat() approach.

challenges.title: Shallow Copy with Spread
challenges.description: Demonstrate how spread operator creates a shallow copy of an array and modify the copy without affecting the original.

task.title: Advanced Spread Operator Applications
task.problemStatement: Explore the versatility of spread operator across arrays, objects, and function arguments. Demonstrate practical use cases and syntax variations.

challenges.title: Spread in Function Arguments
challenges.description: Create a function that accepts multiple parameters and call it using spread operator on an array of values.

challenges.title: Spreading Objects
challenges.description: Use spread operator to merge multiple objects and handle property overwriting scenarios.

challenges.title: Spread with Strings
challenges.description: Convert a string to an array of characters using spread operator and perform string manipulation.

task.title: Array Iteration Fundamentals
task.problemStatement: Master the differences between forEach() and map() methods. Understand when to use each for different iteration scenarios.

challenges.title: forEach for Side Effects
challenges.description: Use forEach() to iterate an array and perform side effects like logging, DOM manipulation, or data accumulation.

challenges.title: map to Transform Data
challenges.description: Create an array of objects and use map() to extract specific properties or transform values into a new array.

challenges.title: forEach vs map Comparison
challenges.description: Demonstrate the return value differences and practical scenarios where one method is better than the other.

task.title: String and Array Conversion
task.problemStatement: Learn to convert between arrays and strings using join() and split() methods. Handle edge cases and delimiters.

challenges.title: Array to String Conversion
challenges.description: Use join() to convert an array into a string with different delimiters like comma, dash, or custom strings.

challenges.title: String to Array Parsing
challenges.description: Parse CSV or tab-separated data using split() method and handle empty strings or special characters.

challenges.title: Reversible Conversions
challenges.description: Create a function that converts an array to string and back, demonstrating reversibility with specific delimiters.

task.title: Array Sorting Techniques
task.problemStatement: Master the sort() method with custom comparators. Sort strings, numbers, and objects by different criteria.

challenges.title: Numeric Sort with Comparator
challenges.description: Sort an array of numbers in ascending and descending order using a proper comparator function.

challenges.title: Sort Objects by Property
challenges.description: Create an array of objects and sort them by a specific property value with case-insensitive string sorting.

challenges.title: In-place vs Non-destructive Sort
challenges.description: Demonstrate how sort() mutates the original array and create a non-destructive sorting approach.

task.title: Type Checking for Arrays
task.problemStatement: Use Array.isArray() to properly identify arrays and distinguish them from other objects. Understand why typeof fails for arrays.

challenges.title: Array vs Object Detection
challenges.description: Write a function that uses Array.isArray() to differentiate between arrays and plain objects.

challenges.title: Nested Array Checking
challenges.description: Create a function that checks if deeply nested values are arrays using recursive Array.isArray() calls.

challenges.title: Type Guard Utility
challenges.description: Build a utility function that validates array input and provides appropriate error handling.

task.title: Object Type Verification with instanceof
task.problemStatement: Use instanceof operator to check object types and understand prototype chain relationships.

challenges.title: Basic instanceof Usage
challenges.description: Create custom objects and test them with instanceof to verify their type and constructor.

challenges.title: Built-in Type Checking
challenges.description: Use instanceof with built-in types like Date, RegExp, Error, and custom class instances.

challenges.title: Prototype Chain Testing
challenges.description: Explore how instanceof checks the entire prototype chain and test with inherited objects.

task.title: Array Filtering Mastery
task.problemStatement: Master the filter() method to create new arrays based on conditions. Handle complex filtering scenarios.

challenges.title: Simple Predicate Filtering
challenges.description: Filter an array of numbers to get only even numbers, or filter strings by length threshold.

challenges.title: Object Array Filtering
challenges.description: Filter an array of user objects based on multiple criteria like age range or status.

challenges.title: Chained Filtering
challenges.description: Apply multiple filter operations in sequence and compare with a single combined filter.

task.title: Array Search and Retrieval
task.problemStatement: Use find() method to locate and return the first element matching a condition. Understand differences from filter().

challenges.title: Simple Element Search
challenges.description: Find the first element in an array matching a specific condition using find() method.

challenges.title: Object Property Search
challenges.description: Search an array of objects for the first item with a matching ID or specific property value.

challenges.title: find vs findIndex vs filter
challenges.description: Compare find(), findIndex(), and filter() methods to understand when to use each approach.

task.title: Data Transformation with map()
task.problemStatement: Master the map() method for transforming array elements. Apply transformations to primitives and objects.

challenges.title: Number Transformation
challenges.description: Map an array of numbers to transform them (multiply, square, convert to strings, etc.).

challenges.title: Object Property Extraction
challenges.description: Map an array of objects to extract specific properties into a new array of values.

challenges.title: Nested Mapping
challenges.description: Apply map() to nested data structures and flatten or reorganize the output.

task.title: Fluent Array Operations
task.problemStatement: Chain multiple array methods together to create readable and efficient data transformation pipelines.

challenges.title: Filter and Map Chain
challenges.description: Chain filter() and map() methods to first select items and then transform them.

challenges.title: Complex Data Pipeline
challenges.description: Create a chain of operations including filter, map, sort, and slice on an array of objects.

challenges.title: Optimization: Chain vs Loop
challenges.description: Compare performance and readability between method chaining and traditional loops.

task.title: Advanced Array Reduction
task.problemStatement: Master reduce() method for accumulating values, transforming arrays, and complex data aggregation.

challenges.title: Sum and Average Calculation
challenges.description: Use reduce() to calculate sum, average, or other statistics from an array of numbers.

challenges.title: Array to Object Transformation
challenges.description: Use reduce() to transform an array into an object with keys or group items by property.

challenges.title: Chaining with Reduce
challenges.description: Combine reduce() with other methods or use reduce() multiple times for complex transformations.

title: Comparing Methods: sort vs filter vs map vs reduce

task.title: Array Methods Comparison
task.problemStatement: Analyze and compare filter(), map(), sort(), and reduce() methods. Understand when to use each and their performance characteristics.

challenges.title: Use Case Matching
challenges.description: Given various scenarios, identify which array method (filter/map/sort/reduce) is most appropriate.

challenges.title: Equivalent Solutions
challenges.description: Solve the same problem using different methods and compare readability and performance.

challenges.title: Performance Benchmark
challenges.description: Write performance tests comparing these methods on large datasets.

task.title: Array Interview Preparation
task.problemStatement: Solve common array-related interview questions covering various array methods and problem-solving approaches.

challenges.title: Flatten Nested Array
challenges.description: Write a function to flatten a multi-level nested array into a single-level array.

challenges.title: Remove Duplicates
challenges.description: Create a function to remove duplicate values from an array while preserving order.

challenges.title: Array Rotation and Manipulation
challenges.description: Implement functions to rotate arrays or perform other common array manipulations.

task.title: Advanced Function Concepts
task.problemStatement: Explore advanced function features including callbacks, higher-order functions, and functional programming patterns.

challenges.title: Higher-Order Functions
challenges.description: Create functions that accept or return other functions as arguments or results.

challenges.title: Callback Functions
challenges.description: Implement functions that use callbacks for asynchronous-like operations or event handling.

challenges.title: Functional Composition
challenges.description: Create utility functions to compose multiple functions together for reusable transformations.

task.title: Function Declaration and Expression
task.problemStatement: Understand differences between function declarations, function expressions, and arrow functions including hoisting and this binding.

challenges.title: Hoisting Behavior
challenges.description: Create examples demonstrating hoisting differences between declarations and expressions.

challenges.title: Arrow Function vs Regular Functions
challenges.description: Compare arrow functions with regular functions highlighting this binding and syntax differences.

challenges.title: Choosing the Right Type
challenges.description: Identify scenarios where each function type is most appropriate.

task.title: Understanding Function Hoisting
task.problemStatement: Master function hoisting behavior. Understand how function declarations are hoisted differently from expressions and variable declarations.

challenges.title: Function Declaration Hoisting
challenges.description: Demonstrate calling a function before its declaration in code due to hoisting.

challenges.title: Expression vs Declaration Hoisting
challenges.description: Show why function expressions cannot be called before declaration while declarations can.

challenges.title: Hoisting with let and const
challenges.description: Explain temporal dead zone and why let/const functions have different hoisting behavior.

task.title: Immediately Invoked Function Expressions
task.problemStatement: Master IIFE patterns for creating isolated scopes, module patterns, and avoiding global namespace pollution.

challenges.title: Basic IIFE Pattern
challenges.description: Write an IIFE that executes immediately and demonstrates scope isolation.

challenges.title: IIFE Module Pattern
challenges.description: Create a module using IIFE pattern with public and private variables.

challenges.title: IIFE with Parameters
challenges.description: Pass arguments to IIFE for configuration and demonstrate parameter handling.

task.title: Arguments Object and Parameter Handling
task.problemStatement: Work with function arguments using the arguments object. Handle variable number of parameters.

challenges.title: Arguments Object Access
challenges.description: Create a function that accesses and processes arguments dynamically using the arguments object.

challenges.title: Convert Arguments to Array
challenges.description: Convert the arguments object to a real array using various techniques.

challenges.title: Variable Arguments Function
challenges.description: Build a function that accepts variable number of arguments and processes them appropriately.

task.title: Rest Parameters and Variadic Functions
task.problemStatement: Use rest parameters to handle variable number of function arguments. Understand advantages over arguments object.

challenges.title: Basic Rest Parameters
challenges.description: Create functions using rest parameters (...args) to accept variable number of arguments.

challenges.title: Rest with Fixed Parameters
challenges.description: Combine fixed parameters with rest parameters to handle mixed argument patterns.

challenges.title: Rest vs arguments Object
challenges.description: Compare rest parameters with arguments object demonstrating advantages of rest parameters.

task.title: Function Parameter Defaults
task.problemStatement: Set default parameter values for functions. Handle undefined arguments and optional parameters.

challenges.title: Basic Default Parameters
challenges.description: Create functions with default parameter values and observe behavior when arguments are omitted.

challenges.title: Computed Default Values
challenges.description: Use expressions or function calls as default parameter values.

challenges.title: Defaults with Rest Parameters
challenges.description: Combine default parameters with rest parameters for flexible function signatures.

task.title: Getter and Setter Methods
task.problemStatement: Implement getter and setter methods for controlled property access and validation.

challenges.title: Basic Getters and Setters
challenges.description: Create a class with getter and setter methods for private property management.

challenges.title: Validation in Setters
challenges.description: Implement setters with validation logic to ensure data integrity.

challenges.title: Computed Properties
challenges.description: Create getters that compute and return derived values from other properties.

task.title: Exception Handling Patterns
task.problemStatement: Master try/catch/finally blocks and throw custom errors. Implement proper error handling strategies.

challenges.title: Try-Catch Basics
challenges.description: Write try-catch blocks to handle potential errors in code execution.

challenges.title: Custom Error Throwing
challenges.description: Create functions that validate inputs and throw custom error messages.

challenges.title: Finally Block Usage
challenges.description: Use try-catch-finally to ensure cleanup code runs regardless of success or error.

task.title: Scope and Scope Chain
task.problemStatement: Understand global, local, and block scopes. Trace variable resolution through scope chains.

challenges.title: Global vs Local Scope
challenges.description: Demonstrate the difference between global and local variables and their accessibility.

challenges.title: Block Scope with let/const
challenges.description: Create nested scopes using blocks and control variable visibility with let/const.

challenges.title: Scope Chain Resolution
challenges.description: Build nested functions to demonstrate scope chain variable lookup mechanism.

task.title: Variable Declaration Comparison
task.problemStatement: Understand differences between var, let, and const in terms of scope, hoisting, and reassignment.

challenges.title: Scope Differences
challenges.description: Demonstrate how var is function-scoped while let and const are block-scoped.

challenges.title: Hoisting Differences
challenges.description: Show different hoisting behaviors: var hoisting vs let/const temporal dead zone.

challenges.title: Redeclaration Rules
challenges.description: Demonstrate what happens when redeclaring variables with var, let, and const.

task.title: Context and this Binding
task.problemStatement: Master the this keyword and how its value is determined by the calling context and execution environment.

challenges.title: This in Different Contexts
challenges.description: Demonstrate this value in global scope, object methods, and constructor functions.

challenges.title: This in Arrow Functions
challenges.description: Show how arrow functions inherit this from their lexical scope unlike regular functions.

challenges.title: This Loss and Recovery
challenges.description: Identify scenarios where this is lost and demonstrate recovery techniques.

task.title: This Binding Best Practices
task.problemStatement: Learn techniques for maintaining correct this binding in callbacks and event handlers.

challenges.title: call, apply, bind Methods
challenges.description: Use call(), apply(), and bind() to explicitly set the this context.

challenges.title: Arrow Functions as Solutions
challenges.description: Use arrow functions to maintain this context in callbacks and event handlers.

challenges.title: This in Event Listeners
challenges.description: Handle this correctly when using functions as event listeners and callbacks.

task.title: JavaScript Mastery Capstone
task.problemStatement: Consolidate learning by building a comprehensive project integrating array methods, functions, scope, and this binding.

challenges.title: Mini Project: Data Manager
challenges.description: Build a data manager class that uses methods learned throughout the course to manage an array of objects.

challenges.title: Function Utility Library
challenges.description: Create a library of utility functions combining array methods, higher-order functions, and error handling.

challenges.title: Refactor Legacy Code
challenges.description: Take poor quality code and refactor it using modern JavaScript patterns and best practices learned.
